title: Epic 30.3: Eliminate Redundant Redis Calls
description:
STORY: Epic 30.3: Eliminate Redundant Redis Calls

AS A system operator
I WANT Redis calls minimized during conversions
SO THAT system throughput increases and Redis load decreases

NOTES:
### Technical Implementation
- Batch Redis operations using pipelines
- Cache metadata locally during conversion
- Use HMSET for bulk updates
- Target: <5 Redis calls per conversion
### Verification
```bash
# Monitor Redis during conversion
redis-cli MONITOR > /tmp/redis.log &
# Upload and convert file
curl -X POST http://localhost:5000/convert -F "file=@test.pdf" -F "from_format=pdf" -F "to_format=markdown"
# Count commands
grep -c "HSET\|HGETALL\|HMSET" /tmp/redis.log
# Target: <5 calls
```
- 15-20 Redis calls per conversion
- Redundant metadata fetches
- No batching of updates
- `worker/tasks.py` - Add Redis pipeline batching (~40 lines)
- `web/app.py` - Batch status checks (~30 lines)
- `shared/redis_utils.py` - Create batching helpers (new, ~60 lines)

ACCEPTANCE:
* Redis calls reduced from 15-20 to <5 per conversion
* All metadata updates batched
* No functionality regressions
* 70% reduction in Redis load verified with MONITOR
* All tests pass
* Migrated from GitHub Issue #20 (https://github.com/aerocristobal/DocuFlux/issues/20)

title: Upgrade pillow to 12.1.1 to fix out-of-bounds write vulnerability (CVE-2026-25990)
description:
## Vulnerability
Pillow affected by out-of-bounds write when loading PSD images (CVE-2026-25990 / GHSA-cfh3-3jmp-rvhc).

## Impact
An out-of-bounds write may be triggered when loading a specially crafted PSD image. Pillow >= 10.3.0 users are affected.

## Affected Files:
*   `worker/requirements-true.txt`
*   `worker/requirements-gpu.txt`
*   `worker/requirements-false.txt`

## Resolution
Upgrade `pillow` to version `12.1.1` or later in all affected `requirements.txt` files.

## References
*   https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/security/advisories/GHSA-cfh3-3jmp-rvhc
*   https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2026-25990
close_reason: Partially fixed: Pillow>=12.1.1 pinned in CPU build (requirements-false.txt). GPU builds (requirements-gpu.txt, requirements-true.txt) remain blocked by marker-pdf[full] constraint (Pillow<11) - unresolvable until marker-pdf lifts this restriction.

title: Fix HTML injection vulnerabilities in browser extensions (GitHub alerts #63-72)
description:
**GitHub Code Scanning**: 10 open warnings in extension/content.js and extension-firefox/content.js

## Alert breakdown
- Alerts #65, #66, #69, #70, #71, #72: Incomplete multi-character sanitization (js/incomplete-multi-character-sanitization)
  - Strings may still contain <script> or <style> after sanitization
  - Locations: content.js lines 62, 63, 101
- Alerts #67, #68: Bad HTML filtering regexp (js/bad-tag-filter)
  - Regex does not match script end tags like </script > (with space before >)
  - Location: content.js line 62
- Alerts #63, #64: Double escaping/unescaping (js/double-escaping)
  - Replacement may produce '&' characters that are double-unescaped
  - Location: content.js line 104

## Scenario
Given user-generated content is sanitized with regex-based HTML stripping
When the sanitization regex is incomplete (misses variations like </script >)
Then malicious script tags survive sanitization and execute in page context

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Replace regex-based HTML sanitization with DOMPurify or equivalent library
- [ ] Bad tag filter regex updated to handle all end-tag variations (spaces, case)
- [ ] Double-unescaping logic reviewed and fixed
- [ ] Both extension/ and extension-firefox/ updated identically
- [ ] GitHub code scanning alerts #63-72 resolve to 'fixed' after push

title: Epic 33.1: Enable Redis TLS (Issue #8)
description:
STORY: Epic 33.1: Enable Redis TLS (Issue #8)

AS A security engineer
I WANT Redis communication encrypted with TLS
SO THAT credentials and job metadata are protected in transit

NOTES:
### Current Issues
1. Certificates not generated
2. Celery serializer mismatch (web uses JSON, worker uses pickle)
### Technical Implementation
1. Generate certificates with `./scripts/generate-redis-certs.sh`
2. Update docker-compose.yml Redis service:
   ```yaml
   command: redis-server --tls-port 6380 --port 0 --tls-cert-file /certs/redis.crt --tls-key-file /certs/redis.key --tls-ca-cert-file /certs/ca.crt
   ```
3. Update connection URLs to `rediss://redis:6380`
4. Fix Celery serializer on both web and worker (`json` on both)
### Verification
```bash
# Generate certificates
./scripts/generate-redis-certs.sh

# Verify TLS
docker exec docuflux-redis redis-cli -h redis -p 6380 --tls --cacert /certs/ca.crt ping
# Should return: PONG

# Verify full conversion works
curl -X POST http://localhost:5000/convert -F "file=@test.pdf" -F "from_format=pdf" -F "to_format=markdown"
```
- `docker-compose.yml` - Enable Redis TLS (+8 lines)
- `web/app.py` - Update to rediss:// URLs
- `worker/tasks.py` - Update to rediss:// URLs, fix serializer
- `web/app.py` - Fix Celery serializer config

ACCEPTANCE:
* Certificates generated and mounted
* Redis TLS enabled and enforced (no plaintext port)
* Web and worker connect via TLS
* Celery serializer mismatch resolved (JSON both sides)
* Integration tests pass with TLS
* Documentation updated
* Issue #8 closed
* Migrated from GitHub Issue #26 (https://github.com/aerocristobal/DocuFlux/issues/26)

## Vulnerability
Requests vulnerable to .netrc credentials leak via malicious URLs (CVE-2024-47081 / GHSA-9hjg-9r4m-mvj7).

## Impact
Due to a URL parsing issue, Requests releases prior to 2.32.4 may leak .netrc credentials to third parties for specific maliciously-crafted URLs.

## Affected Files:
*   `web/requirements.txt`
*   `worker/requirements.txt`

## Resolution
Upgrade `requests` to version `2.32.4` or later.

## References
*   https://github.com/psf/requests/security/advisories/GHSA-9hjg-9r4m-mvj7
*   https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47081
close_reason: Already fixed: requests==2.32.4 in all requirements files

title: Fix incomplete URL substring sanitization in worker/tasks.py (GitHub alerts #53-54)
description:
**GitHub Code Scanning**: 2 open warnings (py/incomplete-url-substring-sanitization)

## Affected location
- worker/tasks.py line 925: checks for 'kindle.amazon.com' and 'signin.amazon.com' using substring match

## Scenario
Given a URL sanitization check uses substring matching (e.g. 'signin.amazon.com' in url)
When an attacker crafts a URL like 'evil.com/page?redirect=signin.amazon.com'
Then the check passes even though the domain is not actually amazon.com

## Root Cause
Substring checks like `if 'signin.amazon.com' in url` are insufficient — the trusted domain can appear anywhere in the URL, including in path or query params of an untrusted domain.

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Replace substring checks with proper URL parsing (urllib.parse.urlparse)
- [ ] Validate scheme (https only) and netloc (exact domain match or endswith('.amazon.com'))
- [ ] GitHub code scanning alerts #53-54 resolve to 'fixed' after push
- [ ] Unit tests cover bypass attempts (subdomain, path injection, query param injection)

title: Fix path injection vulnerabilities in web/app.py (GitHub alerts #55-62)
description:
**GitHub Code Scanning**: 8 open errors (py/path-injection, severity: error)

## Affected locations in web/app.py
- Line 1047: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1048: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1049: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1057: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1059: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1102: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1105: user-provided value in path expression
- Line 1113: user-provided value in path expression

## Scenario
Given a user-controlled input (e.g. job_id, filename) is used in a file path expression
When the path is not sanitized with os.path.basename() + safe_join() + realpath() checks
Then an attacker can traverse directories (e.g. ../../etc/passwd) to read/write arbitrary files

## Definition of Done
- [ ] All 8 path expressions validated with os.path.basename() and safe_join() or equivalent
- [ ] UUID validation applied to all job_id parameters before path use
- [ ] os.path.realpath() check ensures resulting path stays within allowed directories
- [ ] GitHub code scanning alerts #55-62 resolve to 'fixed' after push
- [ ] Existing tests still pass
close_reason: Added os.path.realpath()+startswith() boundary checks in api_v1_status and api_v1_download; resolves GitHub CodeQL alerts #55-62

title: Upgrade eventlet to 0.40.3 to fix HTTP request smuggling vulnerability (CVE-2025-58068)
description:
## Vulnerability
Eventlet affected by HTTP request smuggling in unparsed trailers (CVE-2025-58068 / GHSA-hw6f-rjfj-j7j7).

## Impact
The Eventlet WSGI parser is vulnerable to HTTP Request Smuggling due to improper handling of HTTP trailer sections. This vulnerability could enable attackers to:
- Bypass front-end security controls
- Launch targeted attacks against active site users
- Poison web caches

## Affected Files:
*   `web/requirements.txt`

## Resolution
Upgrade `eventlet` to version `0.40.3` or later.

## References
*   https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/security/advisories/GHSA-hw6f-rjfj-j7j7
*   https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-58068
